comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

This is pretty simple, 1/5 of the times I click a textbox not exactly at the center, the cursor will not be aligned to the actual textbox.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Just clicking any textbox not exactly in the center
2.
3.

Actual Results:  
textbox "cursor" is desaligned and it will not write

Expected Results:  
align the textbox "cursor" to the textbox, or select it.

Would have liked to send a screenshot

comments.text:
I cannot reproduce the issue on:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110522 Firefox/6.0a1

*Note: This is interesting. 
In reply to Comment 4, have you also tried with a clean Firefox profile http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Profiles
Can you see the issue on any website with text boxes?  
Do you see it also with simple HTML code as in the example found here:
http://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_input.asp?
